content.description: Insecure Slippering slap, work your way up the right side of the rock then left to a top out.
content.location: From the main trail go left around the boulders, there will be a ally way of boulders that leads to a cave. The route is the left boulder.

content.description: Start with your left hand in the obviously chalked rail within the crack and right hand on the small crimp 3 feet above the crack. Follow the crack upwards, lie backing most of the crack, put your right hand on the juggy rail and left hand still around the crack on the top of the route then top out. Be cautious of the slippery rock where graffiti has been covered up, your shoes will commonly slip on it.
content.location: Walk from the trail and under an archway with covered-up graffiti to where a tree is growing in the middle of 2 boulders. The route starts right in front of the tree and follows the obvious crack going up the rock.

content.description: The crux is between the cam and the last clip but if you fall the cam is super bomber. There are plastered holds on the route do NOT use them or it makes it significantly easier. If you are shorter you will have to jump a little to get on the start. You could probably find pictures of the backside of the boulders it has black paint all over the lower part of the rock.
content.protection: One BD 0.5 and then there are bolted anchors. You can extent the anchors with a shoulder length sling (60 cm). There are bolted anchors. You might want boulder pads because the cam placement is 10-15 ft up.
content.location: It is the only obvious line on the back side of the boulder off to the right side and if you go up top there are two bolts for anchors.

content.description: Start with an under cling on a rail, then shimmy yourself to a sketchy chimney, if you are not consistent with your feet in the chimney YOUR FEET WILL SLIP OUT. Climb up the chimney until you can get onto the leftmost ledge with a crack going down the side. Grab a sloper on the crack then do a sketchy move to get onto the ledge. Once you are on the ledge you climb up the under clinging crack system to the top of the route.
content.location: When coming off the main trail turn left. Go down the trail for 20 feet until you see a small cave to the right of you. Go into the cave and right when the cave ceiling opens up that is the begging of the route

content.description: Start with a wide chimney up 2 boulders opposite of each other then you have a far reach to and under clinging crack. After this, match your hands on the under cling. Move your left hand up the crack to a second under cling. Move your feet and smear on the wall until you get them as high as you can. Move your right hand up to a slopy rail. Then move your right hand up to the top of the route and top out. Very insecure route, kind of scary but very fun.
content.location: Walk from the trail and under an archway with covered-up graffiti to where a tree is growing in the middle of 2 boulders. Go to the left of Shoots and Ladders and the route starts between 2 boulders that are opposite of each other.
